description: Pine wood planks with horizontal plank construction and pronounced vertical wood grain

base_colors.note: Pine plank base colors - darker than oak with stronger variation range

alternating_variation.note: Stronger plank variation than oak (+15,+10,+5 vs +10,+8,+5)

separation_lines.note: Stronger separation lines than oak (-25,-20,-10 vs -20,-18,-12)

wood_grain.note: More pronounced grain variation than oak (15 vs 12)

blue_stability.note: Different blue stability than oak (max(-3, adj-2) vs max(-5, adj-3))

dark_spots.description: Horizontal plank separation lines - stronger than oak

light_specks.description: Plank-to-plank variation on alternating planks - stronger than oak

color_clamping.note: Dark brown range for pine wood (darker than oak's 80-200, 60-170, 40-130)

generation_algorithm.step1: Calculate local pixel coordinates: pX_wp = globalX % 16, pY_wp = globalY % 16
generation_algorithm.step2: Start with pine base colors: finalR = 80, finalG = 50, finalB = 20
generation_algorithm.step4: Apply alternating plank variation: if plankY % 2 == 1, add (15,10,5)
generation_algorithm.step5: Generate wood grain: grainNoise = sin(pX_wp * 0.7 + plankY * 0.3) * 0.5 + cos(pX_wp * 0.4) * 0.3
generation_algorithm.step6: Apply grain adjustment with pine blue stability: grainAdjust = grainNoise * 15
generation_algorithm.step7: Apply horizontal plank separation lines: if pY_wp % 4 == 0 && pY_wp > 0, subtract (25,20,10)
generation_algorithm.step8: Clamp colors to dark brown range: r[40-150], g[25-100], b[10-60]
